definition: arrow banner of command (archaic used as symbol of military authority)/fig. instructions from one's superiors
classifier for a ream of paper
to order/to command/an order/warrant/writ/to cause/to make sth happen/virtuous/honorific title/season/government position (old)
to wave a chicken feather as a token of authority (idiom); to assume unwarranted authority on the basis of some pretext
pinyin: na2 zhe5 ji1 mao2 dang4 ling4 jian4

sentences.english: Black king thousand unreal to come in, see the spirit immediately said demon asked arrow wang junwork is stolen.
sentences.chinese: 黑大王一見靈千幻進來，立即說妖王令箭是王俊所偷。

definition: tiger tally (a two-piece object made in the shape of a tiger, used in ancient China as proof of authority. One half of a tally could be issued to a military officer and this would be matched with the other half when verification was required.)
variant of 尚方劍|尚方剑[shang4 fang1 jian4]/imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill
imperial sword (giving bearer plenipotentiary powers)/imperial Chinese version of 007 licensed to kill
imperial sword (giving bearer arbitrary powers)/in fiction, Chinese version of 007's license to kill
act at one's discretion/act as one sees fit
(archaic) wooden or metal token of authority/(fig.) decree/directive/(computing) token
golden seal/characters tattooed on a convict's face
